content: There is another way, but best to go into Troubleshoot mode and see what happens there because it's also a test for other problems. If no problem in Troubleshoot mod, go to TB menu > Add-ons & Themes > Extensions tab. You can disable QuickFolders there.
creator: siffemoz

content:
Try to rebuild the index file of the troubled folder.

Right-click the folder - Properties - Repair Folder
creator: christ1

content:
Lo sviluppo delle estensioni dipende dai rispettivi autori e non da Thunderbird. Nel caso di Quicktest lo sviluppo sembra ancora attivo per cui la compatibilità potrebbe essere ripristinata in futuro.

Ricordo che chi ha bisogno di maggiore compatibilità e stabilità può utilizzare Thunderbird ESR -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/versione-esr-thunderbird
creator: @next

content:
You could go forward from release 146 to daily 148. But you should not switch back from a higher release to a lower release, as a general rule.

You do realize that daily is a less stable environment?
creator: wsmwk

content:
Try deleting those and re-create them this way:

- go to TB menu > Settings > General > Account hub > uncheck 'Create accounts in the new Account Hub'

- go to TB menu > New Account > Newsgroup

content: Go to TB menu > Settings > General > Reading & Display and enable 'Close message window/tab on move or delete'.
creator: siffemoz

content: PPS It appears there is no junk filter function now. The junk mail that re-appeared in the inbox is not marked as junk (so re-applying filter wouldn't work anyhow). But when I ran it all that happened was all the nested message strands expanded.
